intro: Ceropegia sordida, commonly known as the sordid milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Ceropegia sordida is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
